issues.description: The UML in the problem statement specifies the Animal attribute 'name' as type String, but the solution implementation uses a StringBuilder field for the name. This is a structural type mismatch for a core attribute: students reading the UML expect to implement a private String name and corresponding getter/setter, while the reference solution stores the name as a StringBuilder. Although this difference does not change runtime behavior of the provided methods, it is a structural inconsistency that could confuse students about the intended attribute type.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Animal.name attribute type consistent with the UML and problem description by using a String field in the solution (private String name) and adjust constructor/getter/setter accordingly. Alternatively, if StringBuilder is intentional, update the problem statement/UML to indicate the attribute type is StringBuilder so students are not misled.
